facts.fact_text: The HCOB Eurozone Construction PMI fell to 45.3 in January from 47.4 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Eurozone Construction PMI fell to 45.3 in January from 47.4 in December

facts.fact_text: All three major economies reported falling output, with the steepest drop in France and the mildest in Italy, while Germany returned to a sharp decline after a brief rise in December.

evidences.evidence_text: All three major economies reported falling output, with the steepest drop in France and the mildest in Italy, while Germany returned to a sharp decline after a brief rise in December.

facts.fact_text: Input costs rose at the fastest pace since April 2023, driven by higher operating expenses across Italy, France and Germany.

evidences.evidence_text: Input costs rose at the fastest pace since April 2023, driven by higher operating expenses across Italy, France and Germany.

facts.fact_text: Employment rose for the first time since February 2023 as firms in Germany and Italy added staff.

evidences.evidence_text: Despite weak demand, employment rose for the first time since February 2023 as firms in Germany and Italy added staff

claims.claim_text: Demand remained weak and new orders declined.

evidences.evidence_text: as demand remained weak and new orders declined.

claims.claim_text: Overall sentiment remained pessimistic though slightly less negative than in recent months.

evidences.evidence_text: while overall sentiment remained pessimistic though slightly less negative than in recent months.

evidence.evidence_text: Input costs rose at the fastest pace since April 2023
employment rose for the first time since February 2023
as demand remained weak and new orders declined.
